title: RB Henry agrees to $30M extension with Ravens
content: Derrick Henry and the Baltimore Ravens reached agreement Wednesday on a two-year, $30 million extension that includes $25 million fully guaranteed over the next two seasons, agent Todd France told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Draymond fined for questioning officials' integrity
content: Warriors star Draymond Green was fined $50,000 by the NBA for "making an inappropriate comment that questions the integrity of game officials" during Game 3.

title: Cowboys-Commanders, Lions-Vikes set for Xmas
content: The Cowboys will visit the Commanders, and the Lions will visit the Vikings on Christmas Day, it was announced Wednesday.

title: Twins rally to sweep O's, extend win streak to 10
content: Christian Vazquez hit a three-run homer in Game 1, and Kody Clemens added another in Game 2 as the Twins swept the Orioles to extend their win streak to 10 games.

title: Sources: Jenkins skips Pack workouts over deal
content: Elgton Jenkins has stayed away from the Packers' offseason workouts because he wants the team to make it more financially stable to move to center full time.

title: Rory: Being Bryson's best mate not Masters focus
content: LIV Golf League captain Bryson DeChambeau hopes he gets another chance to play with PGA Tour star Rory McIlroy in the final round of this week's PGA Championship at Quail Hollow Club.

title: NWSL players call for changes after King collapse
content: The NWSL Players Association said that play should have been stopped in the game between Angel City FC and the Utah Royals on Friday following the nearly 10-minute delay to provide medical attention to Savy King.

title: 💬 Comments pour in on Tatum's postsurgery post
content: The star forward recently completed surgery on his right Achilles tendon that was ruptured in the Celtics' Eastern Conference semifinals Game 4.

title: Can Boston or Golden State rally? Why one 3-1 deficit is much more dire
content: Two of the past three champs are staring at elimination without their superstars, plus more Round 2 revelations.

title: How Anthony Edwards' hero-ball evolution began with Kobe and Michael Jordan
content: Edwards has become a star in crunch time by learning when to make the right play -- or be the right play himself.

title: Updated 2025 MLB draft rankings: Top 150 prospects -- and a mini-mock draft
content: The race for the No. 1 overall pick is wide open. Here's who your team could be targeting this summer.

title: How Alex Bregman is adjusting to life in a new clubhouse
content: The longtime face of the Astros is now tearing it up for the Red Sox -- while his future remains uncertain.

title: Wait, why didn't my NFL team ____? Graziano makes sense of 10 lingering offseason questions
content: Let's reason on why the Bears didn't improve at RB, why the Steelers didn't plan better at QB and why the Bengals didn't extend Trey Hendrickson (yet).

title: New NBA mock draft: We project all 59 picks
content: With the Mavericks winning the lottery and the right to draft Cooper Flagg, here's our updated two-round mock.

title: Back for more: What will Clark, Reese and 2024 WNBA rookie class do for an encore?
content: The 2024 WNBA rookies had a historic impact. What should we expect from the likes of Angel Reese and Caitlin Clark in Year 2?

title: How could the GOP tax bill affect sports teams?
content: A new tax plan that aims to curb breaks for team owners could lead to increased costs for fans, experts say.

title: 'It's everything I thought it would be': What's next for Rory McIlroy after long-awaited Masters win?
content: It's been just over a month since McIlroy's knees buckled under the weight of a dream finally achieved. He enters the PGA Championship as a distinct favorite, but he's still basking in his Masters title.

title: Tier rankings: From Scottie and Rory to just happy to make the cut
content: Can Rory McIlroy win his second major of the year? Which LIV golfers can contend? We break down the field.

title: Premier League Rookie of the Year: Ranking the best new U19 players
content: The Premier League Rookie of the Year award doesn't exist, but it should. Here are the young players who would be in the running for the 2024-25 prize.

title: Grading how every Big Ten men's basketball team performed in 2024-25
content: Rutgers' star duo fell short of expectations while Wisconsin's John Tonje helped the Badgers surpass theirs.

title: Rested, recharged, stronger than ever: How Fever's Caitlin Clark used offseason to reset
content: When cameras weren't catching her hanging with Taylor Swift, Caitlin Clark honed her game on the court and in the weight room.

title: Onside/Offside: Barça impress, Man United and Tottenham underwhelm
content: What teams showed the best and the worst of the 2024-25 European season? Luis Miguel Echegaray talks about all of that in his latest Onside/Offside column.

title: Sources: Man City eye Wirtz as Liverpool look on
content: Manchester City are pushing to sign Florian Wirtz but face stiff competition from Bayern Munich, a source has told ESPN.

title: Bologna win Coppa Italia as Pulisic, Milan fall short
content: Dan Ndoye's second-half strike earned Bologna a hard-fought 1-0 victory over AC Milan in the Coppa Italia final on Wednesday to secure their first major trophy in 51 years.

title: U.S. investor Ohanian buys stake in WSL's Chelsea
content: Alexis Ohanian, the Reddit co-founder and husband of tennis great Serena Williams, has acquired a 10% stake in Women's Super League champions Chelsea, a source told Reuters.

title: Sources: Liverpool in advanced Frimpong talks
content: Liverpool are in advanced talks to sign Jeremie Frimpong as a replacement for Trent Alexander-Arnold, sources have told ESPN.

title: Amorim won't quit United but insists job on line
content: Ruben Amorim has said he will not quit as Manchester United coach but insisted he will be sacked if results do not pick up.

title: Kulusevski injury adds to Spurs' UEL final crisis
content: Dejan Kulusevski is set to miss Tottenham Hotspur's Europa League final against Manchester United after undergoing surgery on a knee injury.

title: Sources: Barça eye backup for Yamal, Raphinha
content: Barcelona are eyeing a central defender, a full-back and a left winger this summer as they attempt to go one step further in the Champions League next season, sources have told ESPN.

title: The UFC 317 and 319 title fights have big implications for the future
content: Pound-for-pound mainstays litter the main cards of UFC 317 and UFC 319, which means action is on the docket for sure.

title: 2025 NFL schedule analysis: Projections, odds, players to upgrade and downgrade
content: The friendliest and toughest slates in fantasy, who makes the NFL playoffs and the race for the No. 1 pick in 2026.

title: Unexpected statistical trends to exploit going forward
content: Tristan H. Cockcroft examines unexpected statistical anomalies from the first quarter of the 2025 season.

title: Stanley Cup playoff odds: Stars favored to win Cup after decisive Game 4 win
content: Every playoff team's odds to win the 2025 Stanley Cup and favorites for the Conn Smythe Trophy for playoff MVP.

title: What to know ahead of Imola
content: What to know as Formula 1 heads to Imola at Autodromo Internazionale Enzo e Dino Ferrari for round seven of the 2025 season.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye Hudson-Odoi, Semenyo
content: Nottingham Forest's Callum Hudson-Odoi and Bournemouth's Antoine Semenyo are on Manchester United's radar. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Can SC fix deadlines for President, governors’ assent to bills?: Murmu
content: President Murmu has sought the Supreme Court's opinion on the validity of its recent verdict that set deadlines for governors and the President to decide on state bills. Questioning the constitutional basis for such timelines, she invoked Article 143(1) to address concerns about the court's overreach and the concept of deemed assent, deeming it alien to the constitutional framework.

title: Pakistan's appeal to India: Rethink suspension of Indus Waters Treaty
content: Pakistan has appealed to India to reconsider its decision to keep the Indus Waters Treaty in abeyance, citing the dependence of millions on the regulated water. India, however, remains firm on its decision, taken in response to terrorist activities, asserting that changed circumstances and Pakistan's actions warrant a reevaluation of the treaty.

title: IAEA says no report of radiation leak from any Pak facility
content: The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) has refuted claims of a radiation leak from any Pakistani nuclear facility, following reports that Indian missiles struck Kirana Hills during Operation Sindoor. This clarification counters widespread social media speculation and foreign media theories. The IAEA confirmed that, based on available information, no radiation release occurred.

title: Pak inked deal with crypto company in which Trump kin has 60% stake
content: Donald Trump's renewed interest in mediating between India and Pakistan coincides with a recent deal between Pakistan's Crypto Council and World Liberty Financial (WLF), a cryptocurrency venture with Trump family ties. This partnership, involving figures like Zachary Witkoff, raises questions about potential connections between the crypto deal and Trump's shift in stance on the Indo-Pak conflict.

title: Ax-4, with India’s Shubhanshu Shukla, to liftoff on June 8
content: Axiom Space's Ax-4 mission, piloted by India’s Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, is scheduled to launch to the ISS on June 8. The mission, carried by a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket, will include astronauts from India, Poland, and Hungary, marking a return to human spaceflight for each nation after over four decades.

title: Melinda Gates on when she realised its time to end marriage with Bill Gates
content: Melinda French Gates revealed a recurring dream of standing on a crumbling cliff with Bill Gates and their children influenced her decision to divorce. This dream, along with surfacing information like Bill's association with Jeffrey Epstein, served as a catalyst. She also experienced panic attacks during the separation, highlighting the emotional toll of ending their 27-year marriage.

title: India demonstrated tech edge by beating Pak’s Chinese systems
content: India successfully conducted strikes against terror hubs, bypassing Pakistan's air defenses. The Indian Air Force also thwarted multiple retaliatory missile and drone attacks. Indigenous air defence network played a crucial role during the hostilities. The armed forces are on high alert, maintaining operational readiness. India is adhering to the bilateral understanding to cease military action.

title: High court fines firm for fraudulent GST tax credit claim
content: The Delhi High Court has raised concerns about the misuse of a Central Goods and Services Tax Act provision, fining a firm for fraudulently claiming input tax credit (ITC) to evade full GST payment. The court highlighted the potential damage to the GST framework from such large-scale fraud involving fake invoices.

title: 21-day ‘biggest-ever op’ leaves 31 Maoists dead
content: Security forces concluded a 21-day anti-Maoist operation in Karreguttalu Hills. Thirty-one Maoist bodies were recovered. The operation scattered the Maoist command. Amit Shah called it the biggest assault on Maoists. Forces faced difficult terrain. They cleared caves housing arms manufacturing units. The operation busted a major Maoist stronghold. Disjointed Maoist formations are taking shelter in different places.

title: ‘Damage done to Elon’s personal brand is now irreversible’: Fired Tesla employee
content: Matthew LaBrot, a former Tesla Staff Program Manager, claims he was terminated for creating a website, "Tesla Employees Against Elon," which demanded Elon Musk's resignation as CEO. The website argues that Musk's damaged personal brand is negatively impacting Tesla's sales and internal workforce.

title: It’s time a performance audit of HC judges is done: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has voiced concerns over high court judges frequently taking unnecessary breaks, suggesting a need for performance audits to assess their output relative to expenditure. This observation arose during a case where the Jharkhand HC delayed pronouncing a verdict, prompting the SC to emphasize adherence to judgment timelines and propose a monitoring mechanism.

title: Tech glitches disrupt CUET-UG day-2 in conflict-hit J&K, Delhi
content: CUET-UG 2025's second day was marred by technical and logistical failures, impacting over 350 students in J&K and Delhi. Exam cancellations in Srinagar and centre allocation issues in Meghalaya caused significant distress. Students faced challenges like power outages, distant exam centres, and inadequate facilities, raising concerns about the NTA's preparedness and student welfare.

title: With ‘special troops train’, govt signals J&K plan’s on track
content: Indian Railways successfully conducted a trial run of a special train on the Katra-Qazigund section. This section includes the Chenab Bridge. The train carried soldiers and completed a round trip with full security. This trial is significant due to the ongoing Indo-Pak conflict. The new rail line will improve connectivity to Kashmir.

title: US-China trade: Trump says he called Apple CEO after China tariff rollback and...
content: Following a US-China trade agreement where tariffs are suspended for 90 days, President Trump claimed Apple CEO Tim Cook plans to increase US investments, potentially building more plants. This news follows reports of Apple considering iPhone price hikes, possibly linked to tariffs.

title: Odisha clears 11% SEBC quota for admissions in higher education
content: The Odisha cabinet, under CM Mohan Charan Majhi, has approved 11.25% reservation for SEBC in higher education, excluding medical and engineering colleges. This policy, effective this academic year, applies to various courses in government and aided institutions. CM Majhi criticized previous governments for neglecting social justice for backward classes, while Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan hailed the move as historic.

title: US defence strategist hails India’s ‘decisive victory’
content: Military strategist John Spencer says India won Operation Sindoor. He says India destroyed terrorist infrastructure. India demonstrated military superiority. The operation unveiled a new national security doctrine. Spencer notes India's response was overwhelming yet controlled. He adds India handled the crisis without international mediation. India enforced its doctrine on sovereign terms. The operation redefined strategic equation.

title: Indians ground Turkiye, Azerbaijan travel plans
content: Following Türkiye and Azerbaijan's support for Pakistan during Operation Sindoor, Indian tourism to these nations has plummeted. Travel agencies report widespread cancellations and a halt in new bookings due to public anger over perceived hostile actions. The shift reflects a growing sentiment that tourism revenue should not support countries seen as opposing India, leading travelers to explore alternative destinations.

title: Pakistani crew on Hong Kong-flagged ship not allowed to disembark
content: A Hong Kong-flagged tanker, MT Siren II, arrived near Paradip port with crude oil. The tanker had twenty-one Pakistani crew members. Security agencies prevented them from disembarking as a precaution. The vessel is carrying oil for the Indian Oil Corporation refinery. Other crew members from India and Thailand faced no restrictions.

title: 5 hrs after HC deadline, MP cops file FIR against minister Vijay Shah
content: Madhya Pradesh police filed a case against minister Vijay Shah. The action followed a high court order regarding Shah's remarks about Col Sofia Quereshi. The court deemed his comments dangerous. Shah faces charges under the Bharatiya Nyay Sanhita. These charges include endangering national sovereignty and promoting disharmony. The sections carry potential imprisonment and fines. Shah's comments sparked widespread criticism.

title: Tailor arrested at Bathinda base for leaking sensitive info to Pak
content: In Bathinda, authorities arrested Raqib, a tailor working at the military station. This follows the earlier arrest of a cobbler. Raqib, a Roorkee resident, is suspected of sending sensitive information. His mobile is under forensic analysis. Police are investigating the case after the army handed him over. The military base was previously a target during Operation Sindoor.

title: Pro-Pak post sparks violence in West Bengal, cops hurt
content: Violent clashes erupted in Barasat, West Bengal, leaving at least three police officers injured, one seriously, after a social media post allegedly supporting Pakistan triggered outrage. Nazir Hossain, accused of uploading the controversial Facebook post, was arrested. Thirteen others were detained for inciting violence and attacking police during the ensuing protest.

title: Rangers hand over BSF trooper, India lets Pak soldier go home
content: BSF constable Purnam Kumar Shaw, held in Pakistan for 22 days after inadvertently crossing the Punjab border, was released Wednesday. The handover at Attari-Wagah followed tense diplomatic efforts amid Operation Sindoor. Shaw's family in Bengal rejoiced, with his pregnant wife Rajni expressing immense relief. His return coincided with a Pakistani soldier crossing back into Pakistan from Rajasthan.

title: Indigenous ‘Bhargavastra’ test-fired successfully
content: Nagpur's Solar Defence and Aerospace Ltd (SDAL) has successfully tested its anti-drone system, "Bhargavastra," in Odisha. The system can launch 64 micro rockets in a single burst to neutralize drone swarms and disrupt UAVs. This indigenous system will establish a two-layered drone defense, utilizing unguided micro-rockets for broad impact and micro-missiles for precise targeting, enhancing protection against drone attacks.

title: BJP in damage-control mode after Colonel row
content: Following outrage over tribal welfare minister Vijay Shah's remarks on Col Sofiya Qureshi, Madhya Pradesh BJP initiated damage control. A delegation visited Col Qureshi's family, and BJP national president JP Nadda sought a report. Shah, after being summoned by party leaders, expressed regret, claiming his words were twisted and offered multiple apologies if he hurt anyone's sentiments.

title: Retired armyman, 2 sons choke to death in bid to clear domestic drain
content: In a tragic incident in Haryana's Rohtak district, a retired Army man and his two sons died inside a clogged sewer manhole while attempting to clear a blocked drain at their residence in Majra village. Lakshman initially slipped into the manhole, followed by Mahabir and Deepak in a rescue attempt, but all three succumbed, likely due to toxic gases.

title: Sindoor, a made-in-India arms story
content: Operation Sindoor showcased the success of India's indigenous defense industry, with BrahMos missiles, Akash air defense systems, and D4 anti-drone systems playing crucial roles. These Made-in-India weapons effectively countered Pakistani threats, boosting confidence in domestic manufacturing. While India's defense exports are rising, the nation still relies on arms imports, particularly from Russia, France, Israel, and the US.

title: Operation Sindoor: Cong demands answers from Modi govt
content: Rahul Gandhi is set to hold a press conference addressing concerns following the India-Pakistan conflict pause. The Congress Working Committee, chaired by Gandhi, criticized the government's silence, deeming it "inexplicable and unacceptable," especially after US President Trump's announcement and alleged trade pressure. The party also demanded accountability for the "intelligence failure" in Pahalgam.

title: BR Gavai sworn in as 52nd CJI; President’s 14 posers his 1st test
content: Justice Bhushan Ramakrishna Gavai commenced his tenure as Chief Justice of India, receiving blessings from his mother and paying tribute to Dr. B.R. Ambedkar. He faces an immediate task of addressing President Murmu's reference regarding timelines for governors and the President to approve Bills. Gavai's appointment marks him as the first Buddhist and second Dalit to hold the CJI position.

title: Govt rejects another China bid to rename places in Arunachal
content: Government of India has dismissed China's attempt to rename places in Arunachal Pradesh. MEA stated that Arunachal Pradesh is an integral part of India. China has renamed places in Arunachal Pradesh multiple times. China claims Arunachal Pradesh as part of south Tibet. This renaming attempt follows recent military skirmishes. China defends its actions as an exercise of sovereignty.

title: BJP to hold Tiranga Yatra in Srinagar’s Lal Chowk
content: BJP is organizing a Tiranga Yatra in Srinagar's Lal Chowk to celebrate Operation Sindoor, commencing from Sher-e-Kashmir Park. This rally pays tribute to the Army and security forces for dismantling terror hubs in Pakistan, showcasing India's strength. The event follows a Bharat Yatra by Muslim Rashtriya Manch at Lal Chowk, marked by anti-Pakistan slogans.

title: Kohli retires not just as a central force but India's greatest Test captain
content: Virat Kohli has announced his retirement from Test cricket, marking the end of an iconic era. With 40 Test wins as captain, he leaves as India’s most successful red-ball leader. His passionate leadership and consistent performances, especially at No. 4, transformed Indian cricket. The void left behind is immense — on the scoreboard and in spirit.

title: Why Qatar's jet gift to Trump is a nightmare for intelligence officials
content: Donald Trump's acceptance of a luxury Boeing 747 from Qatar has sparked security and ethical concerns among intelligence and diplomatic experts. The opulent aircraft, previously owned by a Qatari royal, raises fears of potential foreign surveillance and compromised communications systems. Senator Mark Warner has criticized Trump's decision as reckless, highlighting the difficulty of thoroughly inspecting the plane for espionage tools.

title: E-commerce sites told to remove Pak flags, merchandise
content: The CCPA has issued notices to Amazon, Flipkart, and other platforms for selling Pakistani flags and merchandise, demanding immediate removal and compliance with Indian laws. This action follows a complaint from CAIT to union ministers, citing heightened national security concerns due to Operation Sindoor. CAIT deemed the sale of Pakistani symbols deeply disturbing amidst the ongoing critical mission against Pakistan.

title: Op Sindoor: How IAF bypassed Pak's China-supplied defence systems
content: Government revealed details of Operation Sindoor. Indian Air Force bypassed Chinese defence systems. They destroyed Pakistani military targets. Strikes occurred at Noor Khan and Rahimyar Khan airbases. India used indigenous platforms. Pakistan's attacks involved Chinese missiles and Turkish drones. Indian air defence systems neutralised these threats. Made-in-India technologies proved successful. Wreckage of foreign weapons was recovered.

title: 'Attractive guy': Why Trump praised a former US-designated terrorist
content: In a historic shift, US President Trump met Syrian interim leader Ahmad al-Sharaa in Riyadh, marking the first such encounter in 25 years. This occurred after the US lifted sanctions on Syria, a move praised by Saudi Arabia but criticized by Israel due to al-Sharaa's past links to al-Qaeda.

title: 'Gandi baatein karni chahiye': Rohit's hilarious clip goes viral - Watch
content: Rohit Sharma's off-field humor is making waves after a clip from an interview with Vimal Kumar went viral. Sharma jokingly remarked about having tough conversations with players regarding team selection, showcasing his candidness. This moment follows Sharma's recent retirement from Test cricket, where he scored over 4,300 runs in 67 matches.

title: Putin To Skip Russia-Ukraine Negotiation Talks In Turkey
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin has announced the names of officials who will represent Russia in the renewed negotiations with Ukraine, set to take place in Turkey today, TASS reported.

title: US Court Orders Release Of Indian Researcher Detained Over Alleged Hamas Ties
content: A US judge ordered the release from custody on Wednesday of an Indian researcher at a top American university who is facing possible deportation for alleged Hamas ties.

title: US Hits Iran's Ballistic Missile Program With New Sanctions
content: The United States on Wednesday unveiled fresh sanctions against six people and 12 firms -- including several Chinese nationals -- for their support of Iran's ballistic missile program.

title: Kuki Group Issues Threat While Manipur Top Cop Oversees Security For Shirui Lily Festival In Ukhrul
content: A Kuki group has warned members of the Meitei community against passing by their villages while going to a district in northern Manipur where the state-level Shirui Lily Festival 2025 is scheduled to be held from May 20 to 24.

title: Over 280 Illegal Religious Sites Removed In Anti-encroachment Drive In UP
content: The crackdown on unauthorised religious structures and illegal encroachments continued on Wednesday in districts bordering Nepal, an official statement issued here said.

title: All Pornography Websites In The US Could Soon Face A Ban Due To This Bill
content: Lee, along with Illinois Representative Mary Miller, unveiled the Interstate Obscenity Definition Act (IODA), which seeks to redefine "obscenity" for the internet era.

title: "China-Made Air Defence System In Pakistan Jammed By Air Force," Says India
content: In a big reveal, the Government of India on Wednesday, said that the Indian Air Force had successfully jammed Chinese air defence systems that Pakistan had installed all along its border and Line of Control with India.

title: In UK Parliament, PM Keir Starmer Praises "Historic, Fantastic" Trade Deal With India
content: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer on Wednesday hailed the "fantastic" Free Trade Agreement (FTA) clinched with India as he came down heavily on the Opposition Conservative Party for wanting to "rip it up".

title: India Pakistan News Highlights: Pakistan Hands Over BSF Jawan To India After 21 Days
content: India Pakistan Ceasefire Highlights: Prime Minister Narendra Modi chaired a meeting of the Cabinet Committee on Security on Wednesday, the first since the pause in hostilities between India and Pakistan.

title: Suspected Spy Arrested In Haryana For Sharing Information With Pak: Cops
content: A suspected spy was arrested in Panipat district on Tuesday for allegedly supplying sensitive information to some individuals in Pakistan, Haryana Police said.

title: X Accounts Of TRT World, Global Times Restored In India After Brief Suspension
content: Turkish news broadcaster, TRT World and the account of the Chinese state-run propaganda mouthpiece, Global Times, are now available in India.

title: 'Operation Sindoor Still Not Over, Refrain From...': BJP Slams Opposition
content: Slamming the Congress and other opposition parties, the BJP on Wednesday asserted that Operation Sindoor is still going on and it has been stopped only temporarily, asking them to refrain from raising "unnecessary and unwanted" questions on the issue

title: Ranthambore Tigress Which Killed 2 People Caught From Behind Local Hotel
content: A tigress -- suspected to be turning into a man eater -- was caught from inside a hotel in Rajasthan's Ranthambore today. The animal was hiding behind a cottage meant for tourists and was tranquilised. She has now been released in an enclosure locate

title: Explainer: How War And Sanctions Decimated Syria's Economy
content: U.S. President Donald Trump has said he will lift longstanding sanctions on Syria that severed the country from the global financial

title: 2-Year-Old Girl Separated From Parents In US Deportation Case Returns To Venezuela
content: A two-year-old girl separated in the United States from her Venezuelan parents, who were deported without her, arrived in Caracas on Wednesday after her separation from her family caused an outcry.

title: Bar Council Modifies Rules, Allows Foreign Lawyers Limited Practice In India
content: The Bar Council of India (BCI) has notified amendments to its regulations, permitting foreign lawyers and law firms to practice foreign law within India.

title: Paris Shop Owner Praised As Hero For Helping Prevent Crypto Kidnapping
content: A Parisian shopowner who helped prevent a masked gang from kidnapping the daughter of a French crypto businessman has been hailed as a hero after he rushed at the

title: Mexican Beauty Influencer, 23, Shot During TikTok Livestream
content: A young Mexican social media influencer, known for her videos about beauty and makeup, was brazenly shot to death during a TikTok livestream, in an incident that sent

title: IREDA Files Bankruptcy Proceeding Against Gensol Engineering
content: Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency (Ireda) on Wednesday said it filed a bankruptcy application against beleaguered Gensol Engineering before the National Company Law Tribunal.

title: US-Qatar Deals To Generate $1.2 Trillion In 'Economic Exchange': White House
content: Agreements signed by Donald Trump and Qatar's Emir Sheikh Tamim bin Hamad AlThani on Wednesday will "generate an economic exchange worth at least $1.2 trillion," the White House said.

title: LSU reigns in latest ranking of recruiting classes
content: Sienna Betts is the younger sister of Lauren Betts . she is the only player in the top 100 who remains undecided . the top 25 women's basketball recruiting classes have at least one tally .

title: Will Harrison Jr. break out? Can McConkey be a No. 1? 2nd-year WR questions
content: the 2025 draft class is focusing on the wide receivers . it's a great group for many fans . there's one question for 13 second-year receivers, based on rookie usage and output . london's marvin Harrison has the most to prove among first-year wide receiver .

title: If Flick can make Barcelona more boring, they'll become unstoppable
content: real madrid beat laliga 3:02 on tuesday night . a total of 25 goals and two trophies were sealed . the UEFA champions league semifinal was a success . it was the final of the laLiga .

title: 2026 recruiting class rankings: Miami makes move after landing five-star OT
content: the recruiting trail is starting to heat up, in anticipation of being set ablaze in June . several five-stars have come off the board recently, including two of the top linemen in the nation . former Miami offensive lineman and current hurricanes coach Mario Cristobal scored a key win in the trenches for his Hurricanes .

title: The lesson of Pete Rose and 'Shoeless' Joe? History is messy
content: if long overdue, reversal of policy, first reported by ESPN's Don Van Natta Jr. . manfred lifted bans on all deceased players, including Pete Rose and "Shoeless" Joe Jackson . most died decades ago and were on the list for gambling-related offenses .

title: The NBA's balance of power shifted on Monday night
content: defending champions Boston Celtics lose Jayson Tatum for the rest of the season . when leBron James chose the Miami Heat on July 8, 2010, when Kevin Durant joined the Golden State Warriors on July 7, 2016. When Kobe Bryant dropped 60 points in the final game of his career on April 13, 2016 .

title: 'My face, my rules': How FSU's Michaela Edenfield made makeup her competitive advantage
content: Michaela Edenfield is an artist at work, recording and sharing "get ready with me" videos . the 6-foot-1 redshirt senior is FSU's starting catcher . "it's the mental preparation behind closed doors," she says .

title: 10 moves that shaped the WNBA offseason -- and what they mean for 2025
content: the 2025 WNBA season tips off later this week, but first, let's look at how we got here . the golden state Valkyries join the league as the first expansion franchise since 2008 . three no. 1 picks who had spent the entirety of their careers with the franchises that drafted them .

title: The 100 most impactful transfers for the 2025 college football season
content: more than 3,400 FBS scholarship players entered the NCAA transfer portal this offseason . the first window lasted from Dec. 9 to Dec. 28 and the second went from April 16 to April 25 . this ranking of 100 is based on production, experience, potential, demand and feedback from coaches and GMs .

title: Nike's Knight: Not interested in buying Blazers
content: shoe co-founder says he is not interested in buying the Portland Trail Blazers . Paul Allen stipulated the eventual sale of his sports properties in his will . there was speculation that Knight, the chairman emeritus of Beaverton, Oregon-based Nike Inc., might step in to buy the team because he had expressed interest in the team .

title: Follow live: Knicks look to finish off Celtics, reach Eastern Conference finals
content: Jayson Tatum was injured late in a 121-113 loss and required surgery on a ruptured Achilles tendon . the Celtics will look to stave off elimination without him . it's a win or go home for the Boston Celtics and Golden State Warriors .

title: MMA pound-for-pound rankings: Who landed in top five, Della Maddalena or Silva?
content: Della Maddalena beats belal Muhammad in the pound-for-pound rankings . the other fighter who earned a spot landed in an even more coveted position in the top 10 . Natalia Silva beat former women's flyweight champion Alexa Grasso . Valentina Shevchenko garnered added support from the voting panel .

title: Andrew Painter and other prospects on the rise
content: the Philadelphia Phillies have one of the top pitching rotations in the major leagues . they haven't seen much of painter in actual games . the 22-year-old is a 2021 first-round pick .

title: NBA playoff futures: Pacers 4th in odds after advancing, Thunder odds-on favorite
content: the Boston Celtics dropped from +280 to 25-1 on the championship odds board . the new york Knicks jumped from 18-1 to the second-shortest odds at +475 . a major shakeup was made after Jayson Tatum's injury .

title: Bengal taps into ‘concert economy’ with new 25-acre tech-entertainment park in New Town
content: “The concept of a concert economy is an innovative idea. We have the infrastructure here… Here, we can host international-level cultural events,” the Chief Minister announced

title: Maharashtra’s Mahalaxmi, Jyotiba temples implement dress code to ‘preserve sanctity’
content: Karveer Nivasini Mahalaxmi and Jyotiba temples in Kolhapur enforce modest attire guidelines for devotees

title: CCPA orders e-commerce firms to remove merchandise carrying Pakistani flag
content: “E-commerce platforms are hereby directed to immediately remove all such content and adhere to national laws,” says Pralhad Joshi

title: BEML flags off 2,100th metro coach in Bengaluru, to set up new unit in Madhya Pradesh
content: The new unit will be developed on 60.063 hectares of land allocated by the Madhya Pradesh government.

title: Pollachi sexual assault case: Tamil Nadu CM Stalin announces ₹25 lakh each to survivors
content: The compensation of ₹25 lakh to each of the eight survivors was in addition to the ₹85 lakh that was awarded by the trial court to the survivors

title: CJI Gavai-led Bench to hear petitions against Waqf law on May 15
content: Over a 100 petitioners have moved the top court against the amendments, saying that they infringed upon the rights of Muslims

title: Tamil Nadu, Delhi, Kerala birth rates declining at twice the rate of national average: Sample Registration System data
content: The birth rates data further revealed that the rate of decline was faster than the national average for 13 large States and union territories

title: Indian team to present in U.N. evidence on Pahalgam terror attack
content: India has accused The Resistance Front of carrying out the April 22 attack and the meeting with the Monitoring Team will be the first step towards getting the TRF banned

title: India ‘pushing back’ Bangladeshis held without documents
content: According to a government official, as many as 295 Bangladeshis were “deported” in 2024, and this year till April 30, around 100 Bangladeshi citizens have been deported and handed over to the Border Guards Bangladesh

title: Ambani flies to Qatar to meet Trump, second meeting since inauguration
content: Mukesh Ambani was also present when Donald Trump visited India last as the U.S. President in February 2020

title: Trinamool to hold rallies to honour soldiers who laid down their lives in India-Pakistan conflict
content: West Bengal CM and Trinamool Congress chairperson Mamata Banerjee, who had extended full support to the Union government in Operation Sindoor, said that she does not see organising events to pay respects to armed forces as a political move.

title: Railway Ministry replaces 'mentally retarded' with 'intellectual disability' in concession forms
content: Railway Ministry replaces offensive terms with inclusive language in concession forms for persons with disabilities

title: Opposition should ‘shed politics’ at least till Operation Sindoor ends, says BJP
content: The issue of Pakistan occupied Kashmir is a bilateral issue to be settled between India and Pakistan, BJP spokesperson Sudhanshu Trivedi said

title: Odisha introduces 11.25% reservation for SEBC students in higher education
content: State Cabinet approves reservation in public universities and colleges from 2025–26 academic session; move seeks to enhance access and equity in line with NEP 2020

title: J&K CM Omar Abdullah promises to build more bunkers for border residents
content: The Chief Minister said more individual bunkers will be built in all shelling-affected regions; Centre built 7,923 bunkers in the vulnerable border districts of the Jammu division

title: Himalayan leap for yak genomic science
content: The first-ever chromosome-level genome of the Indian yak was assembled by specialists from four ICAR institutions

title: Operation Sindoor: Indigenous weapon systems highly effective, says Centre
content: ‘All offensive strikes on Pakistan military targets were executed without loss of Indian assets, underscoring the effectiveness of our surveillance, planning, and delivery systems’, says Press Information Bureau

title: People from other faiths prayed for me, says Assam pastor absolved of ‘magic healing’ charges
content: Pranjal Bhuyan said his arrest under the Assam Healing (Prevention of Evil) Practices Act underscores the need for its careful implementation

title: Delay in convicted BJP MLA’s disqualification upsets Opposition in Rajasthan
content: Congress seeks Governor’s intervention as BJP MLA faces disqualification under RP Act; Speaker’s delay draws flak amidst constitutional debate

title: Take steps to ensure proper footpaths, Supreme Court tells States
content: Court says clear, unimpeded footpaths a fundamental right of pedestrians; Bench says that in the absence of footpaths, pedestrians are forced to walk on roads, making them vulnerable to accidents

title: City NGO committed to preserving Chittara folk art of Malnad’s Deevaru community
content: This folk art involves intricate geometric patterns painted on walls, trays, bamboo or fibre baskets, and is deeply ingrained in the Deevara community’s culture and traditions

title: Two red sanders smugglers nabbed in Kadapa, 9 logs recovered
content: During operations, the teams spotted a motorcycle at a remote location. As they approached, two men tried to flee but were quickly apprehended

title: Police action against anti-war rally in Thrissur sparks outrage
content: Rally, organised by the People’s Anti-War Front, was blocked by the police and several activists were taken into preventive custody

title: Maharashtra cine-employees’ body appeals for boycott of Turkey for film shoots
content: Cine workers’ body appeals to Indian filmmakers to avoid Turkey and Azerbaijan as shooting locations; receives backing from major producers’ associations

title: PACE Institute signs MoU with Malaysian university UTeM to boost academic collaboration
content: The MoU represents a strategic alliance to promote academic exchange, joint research, and technological collaboration between both institutions

title: A.P. students achieve 95.36 per cent pass rate in POLYCET-2025
content: 19 students secure a perfect score of 120 out of 120 marks; girls outperform the boys with a pass percentage of 96.9 compared to 94.38 by the latter

title: Olympian Neeraj Chopra conferred honorary rank of Lt. Col. in Territorial Army
content: Neeraj Chopra, Olympic gold medallist, awarded honorary Lieutenant Colonel rank in Territorial Army by Government notification

title: Funding for Centrally sponsored schemes declining: Karnataka CM
content: As against the mandated release of ₹22,758 crore, the Union government released only ₹18,562 crore to the State during 2024-25, says Siddaramaiah

title: Complete Budameru retaining wall works before June 10, Nimmala tells officials
content: Deploy additional machinery and resources for timely completion and proposals have been prepared to expand the Budameru Diversion Canal’s capacity to 37,500 cusecs, says Water Resources Department Minister

title: ‘Viswaroopa Darshan’ brings curtains on Tirupati Gangamma Jatara
content: According to tradition, it is believed that the eyes of the goddess are so powerful that her focused gaze could burn down an entire area

title: Plus One admissions: 84,225 applications received on first day
content: Applications can be submitted till 5 p.m. on May 20. More than 1 lakh candidate logins have been created

title: Raj Bhavan institutes inquiry into govt. “inspection” at KTU
content: The Higher Education department recently conducted a “surprise inspection” led by an Additional Secretary to probe a complaint by a student, whose application for PhD admission was purportedly rejected.

title: CM for comprehensive development plans for core urban region within ORR
content: Revanth Reddy calls for LIDAR survey for accurate mapping of properties, tanks and nalas in the region

title: Home Minister inaugurates Vuyyuru Rural police station building
content: Police station building was constructed at a cost of ₹1.30 crore; Krishna district SP thanks Penamaluru MLA Bode Prasad and other donors for helping the department complete the construction of the new building

title: Significant cancellations reported in outbound travel to Türkiye and Azerbaijan
content: The RSS-affiliated Swadeshi Jagran Manch urged Indians to avoid travel to Türkiye, and also boycott its products ‘in solidarity with the country’s soldiers, and in national interest’

title: CPI(M), Congress spar over removal of cross in Idukki
content: Forest department had removed a cross erected by the St. Thomas church beside the Neyyassery-Thokkumban road on April 12. The department had registered a case against 18 people, including Fr. James Aikkaramattom, vicar of the church

title: Malawi delegation visits RTGS in Vijayawada
content: Representatives from the Malawi National Water Resources Authority came to study the effective policies adopted by Andhra Pradesh in water resource monitoring

title: Sexual assault on minor girl: Pahalgam police arrest teacher from Vadakara
content: The case was transferred to Pahalgam police as the alleged incident took place in Jammu and Kashmir in 2023

title: Electricity consumption in Kerala crosses 100 million unit mark for the first time in May this year
content: Consumption stood at 100.40 mu on May 12 and 101.21 mu on May 13. Storage in hydel reservoirs managed by KSEB stands at 32%

title: WhatsApp reports drive ₹75 lakh in challans for traffic violations in Cyberabad
content: Between January 1 and May 13, 2025, about 18,685 cases have been registered through complaints received on helpline number 94906 17346, resulting in challans totalling ₹75 lakh

title: Technical glitch resulted in faster decomposition of body at Aluva District hospital, says report
content: The relatives of the deceased alleged that the body had decomposed as the hospital authorities had failed to switch on the unit after it was placed there following the inquest proceedings around 9 p.m. on May 6, 2025

title: Mock drill conducted to test disaster preparedness
content: The exercise included live demonstrations of rescue operations, beginning from the moment of a simulated accident to the evacuation of victims, administration of emergency medical aid, and transfer of victims to nearby hospitals

title: Focus on tourism, aim for 15 per cent growth in Palnadu: Lanka Dinakar
content: The 20-Point Programme Committee Chairperson urges on preparation of detailed project reports to attract government funding and private investment in tourism

title: Downpour rattles urban dwellers in Hubballi, Dharwad
content: Heavy rains lashed various parts of Dharwad district including the twin cities on Tuesday night leaving several roads waterlogged and inundation in low lying areas in villages and towns.

title: Collector B.R. Ambedkar releases UJF handbook in Vizianagaram
content: The District Collector highlights the role of journalists in bridging the gap between the Government and public

title: PM SHRI Kendriya Vidyalaya Sattenapalli shines with 100 per cent pass rate in Class X exams
content: J. Yashwant emerges school topper with 95.8 per cent, followed by Tapan Chowdhary at 91 per cent and Pritam Sai Narayan Naik (90 per cent)
